title: Key Fragment drop rates are too skewed compared to Boxes...
body:
Edit: My impression may be based on incorrect information.  If each champion is only eligible for 1 box per season, rather than 1 box per month, then the key fragment drop rates are more understandable.  I don't mind Hextech Crafting being difficult.  I just don't want to end up with a ridiculous number of unopened boxes by the end of the season.  I still do have some concerns, since I doubt that I can get even 1 or 2 key fragments on average per week at the current rate.  I will wait and see before providing more feedback however.

Like a lot of other players, I am getting a lot more box drops than key fragment drops.  Since each box requires 3x key fragments to open, this feels pretty lame.  The key fragments are so rare that I expect myself to be buried in pointless, rotting boxes within a few months.  Something needs to be done.  In my experience, keys need to be 11x more common to reach the number required to open boxes at their current rate.  That seems awfully excessive.

Key fragment drops need to be drastically increased.  Making key fragments a 100% drop from the first win of the day would be great for honest players who aren't willing to resort to botting to grind the ~100 games per key at the current insane rate...  

Making boxes S and S+ only would also be a good idea.  S- is probably a little bit too easy to achieve to deserve a box drop in all honesty.

I don't think key and box drop rates need to always balance out, but being skewed so that keys are more than 11x too scarce is beyond ridiculous.

Summary:
1. Increase key drop rates drastically or reward them for first-win-of-the-day
2. Stop rewarding boxes for S- rank

replies.body:
You'll be changing your opinion on the S- once you've gotten boxes on your 30+ best champions and need to acquire an S rank on yet another one.

As for keys: Be aware that the system has only been out for 2 weeks, and yet you could theoretically have 6 boxes so far since you started with 4 available. Going forward, in 2 weeks you would only be able to get 2 additional boxes. Theoretically you should be comparing your current key count to 2 boxes, which if you've received 6 key fragments already you're on track (this is exactly my case, I have 5/6 boxes but only 6 key fragments). 

Obviously when the system is new and you have all champions available boxes are easier (and I do find key fragments to be too rare), but as the months pass I'd imagine you'll struggle to get all of your available boxes and the keys will eventually pile up.

Just some context here, I've also obtained 6 boxes so far, but I've only obtained 4 key fragments.  

Some of my impressions may be based on incorrect information however.  I had read that champion eligibility reset each month.  If that is untrue, then the key fragment rates do seem more reasonable when compared to the boxes.  My concern was that the challenge of obtaining boxes was so much less than the challege of obtaining keys.  If that impression was based on misinformation, then I will gladly reform my opinion.

It actually makes it much better for players who don't play as much or aren't constantly winning. They'll be able to get more keys while they do play and players who play more often won't see a difference other than time between messages.

Champions reset each season, not each month. So it will definitely get harder as the season progresses.

Also, boxes are for each S rank, win or lose. Keys are only possible on wins.

What that means is, if you're a player who tends to either do really well or really poorly, you'll get those S's easily and get boxes, but you'll also lose a lot and not get keys. If you're playing consistently pretty well but not dominating, you'll have a tough time getting boxes but you should be able to get a lot of wins and improve your chances at keys.

I think we'll have to wait at least 3 months or so to really start forming opinions on drop rates and the like.
